title: Expand quiz content, add public cookie consent, update dashboard sidebar styling, adjust compare/contact UI, and refresh finance favicon

requirements.summary: Expand the default quiz dataset to 100 meaningful finance questions without changing quiz flow logic.
acceptanceCriteria: Quiz flow in `frontend/src/pages/Quiz.tsx` can repeatedly fetch/display questions and submit answers without errors.
Quiz statistics show `totalQuestions` as 100 (once the app considers quiz content initialized/available) rather than 2.

file_operations.description: Replace the current 2-item `defaultQuizQuestions` array with 100 unique, finance-related questions spanning mixed topics and difficulties, ensuring every item has id/question/options/correctAnswer/explanation/realLifeTip/topic/difficulty populated (keep quiz behavior/logic unchanged).

requirements.summary: Make the authenticated dashboard sidebar navigation area fully violet with readable, high-contrast text and icons.
acceptanceCriteria: When logged in, the left sidebar (desktop) and the navigation area used for the dashboard menu has a violet background across its full height.
Sidebar text/icons remain readable with sufficient contrast on the violet background.

file_operations.description: Update the authenticated desktop sidebar container styling so the sidebar background is violet across the full height, and adjust nav/user-area text/icon styles as needed to preserve contrast and readability.

requirements.summary: Add a cookie-consent popup for public pages with an Accept button and persisted acceptance; do not show it inside authenticated pages.
acceptanceCriteria: A cookie consent UI is shown on public pages until the user clicks Accept.
Clicking Accept hides the popup and persists acceptance (e.g., via localStorage/cookie) so it does not reappear on subsequent visits.
The cookie popup does not appear inside authenticated app pages (e.g., pages rendered inside the private app layout).

file_operations.description: Implement the CookieConsent UI/behavior: show a dismissible banner/modal on public browsing until accepted; persist acceptance in browser storage; and ensure it returns null when the user is authenticated. Use shadcn-ui Button/Card (or similar) to match existing UI patterns. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire CookieConsent into the public-page UI by rendering it from the public Header so it appears across public pages that use Header, while remaining absent from the authenticated/private AppLayout. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Update the public contact/support UI to display the email address fwiseai@gmail.com wherever shown.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/pages/Contact.tsx` displays `fwiseai@gmail.com` instead of the previous support email.
No remaining UI text on public contact/support pages shows the old contact email address.

file_operations.description: Replace the displayed support email text with `fwiseai@gmail.com` in the Contact page UI.
Replace the displayed support email text with `fwiseai@gmail.com` in the Customer Care (support) page UI to ensure no public support UI shows the old address.

requirements.summary: Remove the “No Ads” and “Video Lessons” rows from the Compare page table while keeping the layout aligned.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/pages/Compare.tsx` no longer renders rows labeled “No Ads” and “Video Lessons”.
The compare table layout remains aligned and visually consistent after removing the rows.

file_operations.description: Update the `features` list to remove entries named “No Ads” and “Video Lessons”, keeping the comparison grid rendering unchanged otherwise.

requirements.summary: Redesign and apply a finance-themed, logo-like favicon so it appears in browser tabs.
acceptanceCriteria: The favicon used by the site reflects the new finance-themed, logo-like design.
The favicon is referenced correctly so it appears in the browser tab when running the frontend.

file_operations.description: Redesign the existing SVG into a more finance-related, logo-like favicon mark (per request: favicon.svg > favicon.svg) while keeping it suitable for small sizes.
Verify favicon references remain correct (including the primary `/favicon.svg` link) so the redesigned favicon appears in the browser tab when running the frontend.
